definition: thermodynamic temperature scale (in degrees Kelvin, measured above absolute zero)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: According to it thermodynamic temperature scale can be realized.
sentences.chinese: 根据它可以用理想气体实现热力学温标。

definition: Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)
Planck's constant h, approximately equal to 6.626 x 10^-34 joule.seconds or 4.135 x 10^-15 electron volt.seconds
Rudolf Clausius (1822-1888), German physicist and mathematician
Reynolds number (ratio of inertial forces to viscous forces in fluid mechanics)
Ludwig Boltzmann (1844-1906), Austrian physicist and philosopher
